channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: This guy has 45 credit cards. Here’s what you can learn from his strategy.
item.description: Dave Grossman carries a “Costanza wallet,” and he says he’s reaped rewards aplenty as a result.

item.title: My job is offering me a payout. Should I take a $61,000 lump sum or $355 a month for life?
item.description: “My S&P 500 investments have roughly doubled every seven years.”

item.title: The Download: Google DeepMind’s DNA AI, and heatwaves’ impact on the grid

item.title: Why your Social Security check could shrink by nearly 20% — and more if jobs are scarce
item.description: America’s retirement trust fund is expected to run dry by 2034. A U.S. economic downturn would only make a bad situation worse.

item.title: Chip stocks are reclaiming market leadership. Here’s why analysts are optimistic.
item.description: Nvidia’s stock closed at a new all-time high on Wednesday, while Micron delivered an earnings beat on AI-driven demand for its memory chips

item.title: My friend asked me to chip in $1,600 for her son’s prom-night limo. Has the world gone mad?
item.description: “He is handsome and popular and has maintained good grades. My friend wanted to do something special.”

item.title: It’s officially summer, and the grid is stressed
item.description: It’s crunch time for the grid this week. As I’m writing this newsletter, it’s 100 °F (nearly 38 °C) here in New Jersey, and I’m huddled in the smalles...

item.title: Nvidia’s ‘AI Factory’ narrative faces reality check as inference wars expose 70% margins
item.description: Alternative chip makers expose the contradiction in Nvidia's AI factory story: How can inference be a commodity while commanding 70% margins?

item.title: IBM sees enterprise customers are using ‘everything’ when it comes to AI, the challenge is matching the LLM to the right use case
item.description: Real-world deployment patterns show customers using multiple AI models simultaneously, forcing a fundamental shift in enterprise AI architecture.

item.title: For Replit’s CEO, the future of software is ‘agents all the way down’
item.description: Replit's agents can help non-developers design and code an app in a mere 15 minutes, illustrating the disruprtion of vibe coding.

item.title: Creatio’s new 8.3 Twin CRM update hits Salesforce where it hurts: ‘we don’t think of AI as an add-on…it’s just part of our app experience’

item.title: Boston Consulting Group: To unlock enterprise AI value, start with the data you’ve been ignoring
item.description: Companies are looking beyond the experimental phase of AI and exploring ways to productize and scale agents and other applications.
